description: List consisting of all functions from [1,2,3,...,n] into [1,2,3,...,n] for n=1,2,3,... (written out in full) in lexicographic order.
comments: Includes every finite sequence of positive integers. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jan 26 2006
example: For n=1 there is one function, 1. For n=2 there are 4 such functions and ordering these lexicographically we get (1,1), (1,2), (2,1), (2,2). Thus the sequence begins 1; (1,1), (1,2), (2,1), (2,2); ...
author: Avi Peretz (njk(AT)netvision.net.il), Feb 06 2001
